Definition.WordDefinition: LONGEVITY, n. Uncommon extension of the fear of death.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Longevity \Lon*gev"i*ty\, n. [L. longaevitas. See {Longevous}.] Long duration of life; length of life. [1913 Webster]
The instances of longevity are chiefly amongst the abstemious. --Arbuthnot. [1913 Webster]
longevity n 1: duration of service; "her longevity as a star"; "had unusual longevity in the company" [syn: {length of service}] 2: the property of being long-lived [syn: {seniority}]
